channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: "You Better Turn Back": Israel Warns Greta Thunberg On Gaza-Bound Yacht

media:content.media:description: Activist Greta Thunberg sits aboard the aid ship Madleen.

item.description: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz told the military on Sunday to stop a charity boat carrying activists, including Sweden's Greta Thunberg, who are planning to defy an Israeli blockade and reach Gaza.
item.content:encoded: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz told the military on Sunday to stop a charity boat carrying activists, including Sweden's Greta Thunberg, who are planning to defy an Israeli blockade and reach Gaza.

item.title: "We Found Mohammed Sinwar Here": Israel Reveals Tunnel Under Gaza Hospital

media:content.media:description: Israeli soldiers walk out from a tunnel underneath a hospital in Khan Younis at the Gaza Strip

item.description: The Israeli army said on Sunday it had retrieved the body of Hamas' military chief Mohammed Sinwar in an underground tunnel beneath a hospital in southern Gaza, following a targeted operation last month.
item.content:encoded: The Israeli army said on Sunday it had retrieved the body of Hamas' military chief Mohammed Sinwar in an underground tunnel beneath a hospital in southern Gaza, following a targeted operation last month.

item.title: Trump Deploys National Guard Over Los Angeles Immigration Protests

media:content.media:description: Members of the California National Guard stand outside the Edward R Roybal federal building.

item.description: National Guard troops began arriving in Los Angeles early Sunday after being ordered there by US President Donald Trump, a rare deployment against the state governor's wishes after sometimes violent protests against immigration enforcement raids.
item.content:encoded: National Guard troops began arriving in Los Angeles early Sunday after being ordered there by US President Donald Trump, a rare deployment against the state governor's wishes after sometimes violent protests against immigration enforcement raids.

item.title: Viral Video Shows New Pope Apologising For Being "Little Late"

media:content.media:description: Pope Leo XIV was elected on May 8 this year. (File)

item.description: Addressing a gathering of Christian leaders at a landmark conference marking the 1,700th anniversary of the First Council of Nicaea, the Pope skipped the usual formalities and began with an apology.
item.content:encoded: Addressing a gathering of Christian leaders at a landmark conference marking the 1,700th anniversary of the First Council of Nicaea, the Pope skipped the usual formalities and began with an apology.

item.title: US Man Gets Life In Prison For Breaking Spine Of 2-Year-Old, Killing Her

media:content.media:description: The court sentenced Travis Ray Thompson to life imprisonment.

item.description: A Florida man has been sentenced to life in prison for the brutal killing of his ex-girlfriend's 2-year-old daughter.
item.content:encoded: A Florida man has been sentenced to life in prison for the brutal killing of his ex-girlfriend's 2-year-old daughter.

item.title: Bangladesh's Yunus To Embark On UK Visit, His 11th Foreign Trip In 10 Months

media:content.media:description: Muhammud Yunus will leave for his 11th visit abroad during his ten months in the government

item.description: Yunus will meet His Majesty King Charles III and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer during the visit which is scheduled from June 9-13.
item.content:encoded: Yunus will meet His Majesty King Charles III and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer during the visit which is scheduled from June 9-13.

item.title: 'Harvard Is Starting To Behave': Donald Trump On Student Visa Row

media:content.media:description: McMahon gave Trump the credit for pushing the universities to take steps to combat antisemitism

item.description: Amid accusations on Harvard and Columbia of fomenting antisemitism, Trump had cancelled $2 billion in grants to Harvard and $400 million in grants to Columbia.
item.content:encoded: Amid accusations on Harvard and Columbia of fomenting antisemitism, Trump had cancelled $2 billion in grants to Harvard and $400 million in grants to Columbia.

item.title: 1.7 Million Eggs Recalled Across US Amid Salmonella Outbreak, 79 Cases So Far

media:content.media:description: No deaths have been reported so far.

item.description: The recall, initiated by the August Egg Company based in Hilmar, California, follows reports of 79 illnesses across seven states, with 21 hospitalisations.
item.content:encoded: The recall, initiated by the August Egg Company based in Hilmar, California, follows reports of 79 illnesses across seven states, with 21 hospitalisations.

item.title: Trump 'Peeved' Over Musk's Claim That He Was Named In Epstein Files: Report

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump was peeved by Elon Musk's claim that he was named in the Epstein Files

item.description: According to the report, most lawmakers and Republicans agree that Trump would have the upper hand if their feud gets reignited, but Musk, as the world's riches man, with X on his side, would be a tough contender.
item.content:encoded: According to the report, most lawmakers and Republicans agree that Trump would have the upper hand if their feud gets reignited, but Musk, as the world's riches man, with X on his side, would be a tough contender.

item.title: Canada's New Citizenship Bill: What It Means For Indians, Those Born Abroad

media:content.media:description: This bill is expected to benefit the Indian diaspora and other immigrant communities in Canada

item.description: This bill is expected to benefit the Indian diaspora and other immigrant communities amid the Trump administrations tightening of immigration policies in the United States.
item.content:encoded: This bill is expected to benefit the Indian diaspora and other immigrant communities amid the Trump administrations tightening of immigration policies in the United States.

item.title: Gaza Aid Group Pauses Operations Over Hamas Threats - Group Denies Claims

media:content.media:description: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation announced on Saturday that they were pausing operations on Saturday

item.description: Although the statement did not give information on the threats, they were directed at the foundations drivers, and at Palestinian staff who are helping with the operations at distribution sites.
item.content:encoded: Although the statement did not give information on the threats, they were directed at the foundations drivers, and at Palestinian staff who are helping with the operations at distribution sites.

item.title: Hamas-Linked Mujahideen Leaders, Who Killed Bibas Children, Neutralised

media:content.media:description: The Mujahideen Brigades operate primarily in the Gaza Strip.

item.description: Asaad Abu Sharia, leader of the Mujahideen Brigades, a small Hamas-allied group in Gaza, was killed in an airstrike in Gaza, the Israeli military confirmed.
item.content:encoded: Asaad Abu Sharia, leader of the Mujahideen Brigades, a small Hamas-allied group in Gaza, was killed in an airstrike in Gaza, the Israeli military confirmed.

item.title: Who Is Zohran Mamdani, Indian-Origin Contesting New York Mayoral Polls
item.description: Indian-origin New York State Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani has emerged as a surprise contender in the 2025 New Yorkmayoral race.
item.content:encoded: Indian-origin New York State Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani has emerged as a surprise contender in the 2025 New Yorkmayoral race.

item.title: Pakistan's Controversial Detention Law In Balochistan, What It Means

media:content.media:description: The legislation has been met with strong criticism.

item.description: The legislation allows military and intelligence agencies, including the Pakistan Army and ISI, to detain individuals for up to 90 days without filing any formal charges or presenting them in court.
item.content:encoded: The legislation allows military and intelligence agencies, including the Pakistan Army and ISI, to detain individuals for up to 90 days without filing any formal charges or presenting them in court.

item.title: How An Indian Student In US Lost $5,000 To Fake Immigration Officers

media:content.media:description: Shreya Bedi, an Indian student on F-1 visa was duped by scammers pretending to be ICE agents

item.description: Shreya Bedi, a Masters student at Indiana University Bloomington came to the United States in 2022 on an F-1 visa and was duped by scammers pretending to be Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents.
item.content:encoded: Shreya Bedi, a Masters student at Indiana University Bloomington came to the United States in 2022 on an F-1 visa and was duped by scammers pretending to be Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents.

item.title: Indian Engineer Dies During Scuba Diving Session In Dubai

media:content.media:description: Issac Paul Olakkengil, died at Jumeirah Beach, Dubai (Representative image).

item.description: Paul Olakkengil was in Dubai with his family, enjoying the Eid holidays, when tragedy struck during the scuba diving training session.
item.content:encoded: Paul Olakkengil was in Dubai with his family, enjoying the Eid holidays, when tragedy struck during the scuba diving training session.

item.title: China Expert Warns Of "Something Worse" Than Covid After US Fungus Smuggling Case

media:content.media:description: Gordon Chang told Fox News US needs to be careful against "something worse" than Covid

item.description: A top US-based expert on China has warned of "something worse" than Covid if the United States is not careful, days after two Chinese scientists were charged with allegedly smuggling a toxic fungus into the US.
item.content:encoded: A top US-based expert on China has warned of "something worse" than Covid if the United States is not careful, days after two Chinese scientists were charged with allegedly smuggling a toxic fungus into the US.

item.title: "If Elon Chilled Out...": JD Vance On Elon Musk-Donald Trump Feud

media:content.media:description: "It's a good bill," Vance insist. "It's not a perfect bill."

item.description: Elon Musk is making a "huge mistake" by targetingthe President of the United States, JD Vance has said.
item.content:encoded: Elon Musk is making a "huge mistake" by targetingthe President of the United States, JD Vance has said.

item.title: Birds Build Nests Using Fibre Optics Found In FPV Drones In Ukraine

media:content.media:description: Birds on the front lines weave their nests from fibre optics.

item.description: In Ukraine, birds use fibre optics from used drones to build nests. They use it as they would use grass, hair or fur.
item.content:encoded: In Ukraine, birds use fibre optics from used drones to build nests. They use it as they would use grass, hair or fur.

item.title: Mother Of Colombian Leader Shot In Head Was Kidnapped By Pablo Escobar
item.description: Diana Turbay was a journalist and was kidnapped in 1990 by a group working under drug lord Pablo Escobar. She died in a failed rescue attempt.
item.content:encoded: Diana Turbay was a journalist and was kidnapped in 1990 by a group working under drug lord Pablo Escobar. She died in a failed rescue attempt.
